choices: Elizabeth opens a tear to our world and time (except everything is small!)
Elizabeth travels to a world where she is giant and worshipped as a goddess
She finds a size control vigor in her tower and breaks free
She shrinks... You!
Another scenario?
1.content: Which scenario shall we use to start our story?
1.title: Begin

choices: Take a quick sip from the bottle
Leave it alone for now
Before she can decide, something else happens
13.content:
Elizabeth stood by the window on the upper level Monument Tower’s library, peering down upon the city of Columbia below. She watched as exploding fireworks and drifting balloons danced colorfully above the distant skyline, signifying the beginning of yet another celebration that she could not attend. After a few seconds of observing the activities of the outside world, Elizabeth sighed and turned away from the window, noticing her lone shadow cast upon the wooden floor by the warm rays of the sun.

All I want is to get away, Elizabeth thought, but it’s like there’s no way out of this place. Elizabeth turned toward a nearby table and picked up her prized photograph of the Eiffel Tower, staring into it as though it was a window to another world. I know the exact location of every major city in the world, but I can’t go to any of them. She set the picture down, turning back toward her window and wearily observing the unreachable 4th of July festivities thundering in the distance. “I wonder how much fun they’re having,” she said to herself.

Before Elizabeth could sulk further, she was startled by a sudden whooshing sound behind herself, which shook the entire library for a brief moment. Quickly regaining her composure, she turned to see if something had damaged the room, but everything appeared to be normal. Elizabeth then realized that the sound and feeling of the event felt familiar. That felt like a tear, she smiled, it must have opened downstairs. She hurried down the stairs to the lower level of the library. She saw a thin bottle lying on the center of the floor. It was adorned with ornate, Greco-Roman swirls and contained a dull, green liquid. Elizabeth walked over to the bottle, seeing that it had a symbol that resembled a red fist imprinted on its side, along with a label that denoted the classification of the liquid contained within.

Elizabeth picked up the bottle and read the label closely. “Tower of Babel,” she muttered,” feel the power the gods of old have kept hidden… Until now?” Puzzled, Elizabeth carried the strange liquid back up the stairs to her window to get a better look at the stuff with the help of sunlight. She set it down upon her table and saw that the dark green liquid appeared to be stable, and that all it would take to sample some of it would be removing the cap from atop the bottle.

It must be a vigor, she assumed, but I’ve never seen “Tower of Babel” in any of those Fink pamphlets I received. I wonder what it does? Is it even safe? And if it came through a tear, was it a tear that I opened?

Elizabeth grabbed the bottle, pondering the nature of the vigor and what she would do with it.
13.title: She finds a size control vigor in her tower and...

choices: Booker shows up
Something else
133.title: Before she can decide, something else happens

choices: She believes him; he seems nice enough, right?
She doesn't believe him (fun option)
1331.content:
Elizabeth’s concentration on the “Tower of Babel” Vigor was suddenly disrupted by a loud, metallic crashing that came from the ceiling. She looked up to see that the chained part of Songbird’s entrance had come loose, which allowed a man to fall into the room. He tried to grab the railing of the upper level of the library, but his fingers slipped and he found himself lying flat on the lower floor.

Elizabeth started down the stairs, clutching the Vigor closely as she watched the man rise from his nasty fall. He wore a dark gray vest with a slightly torn red ascot, which flowed nicely with his black, white-lined pants. His face was quite grizzled, with numerous small cuts and scars. Elizabeth was halfway down the stairs when the man rose up, dusted himself off, and locked eyes with her. “Uh, hello,” he began,” my name’s Dewitt, and I’m here to-“”Stay back!” Elizabeth shrieked, slowly stepping back up the stairs.

“Look, I’m here to help you.” Dewitt said as he hurried over to the stairs and began ascending them. In response, Elizabeth held up the Vigor, causing Booker to pause. “Stay away from me,” she insisted,” I know how to use this!”

“That’s a Vigor, miss,” Booker said,” you sure you know what you've got there?”

“Don’t come any closer.” Elizabeth said. Predictably, Booker made the mistake of continuing his attempts at calming the frightened woman while continuing to move toward her. Elizabeth, however, was true to her word, and in one swift motion, she removed the cap off the bottle and took a long, deep gulp of the liquid.

Elizabeth staggered backward, reaching the landing atop the staircase as she fell to her knees. She had anticipated this, as the Fink pamphlets she had received from Songbird had warned of debilitating side effects of Vigor usage that often affected first-time users. However, the effects that Elizabeth felt subsided rather quickly, and she didn't even witnessed any of the hallucinations that supposedly followed the ingestion of a Vigor.

Booker stood near the top of the stairway kept his distance, not knowing what sort of ability the Vigor would give the girl. Despite her petite frame, she had managed to drain the whole bottle, so there wasn't any chance of him getting to figure it out himself. Before Booker’s imagination could get the better of him, he noticed something off about Elizabeth. Huh, he thought, I thought she was shorter just a second ago…

Elizabeth got back onto her feet, but noticed that the room seemed to be smaller than it had been before. Turning toward Dewitt, she held her hand out toward him, hoping to be able to activate whatever ability she had acquired to at least threaten him. But when she tried flexing her muscles in the way that was meant to activate most Vigors, her body suddenly expanded, causing her head to bump against the ceiling.

“What the-” Elizabeth stammered,” What kind of Vigor is this?”

Booker couldn't believe it, but Elizabeth was growing at a rapid rate right before his very eyes. He hurried back down the stairs as she began to curl into a crouching position in the upper level, the floor cracking and groaning under her increasing mass. As Elizabeth felt her body pressured against the ceiling and floor, she panicked and kicked outward, shattering the upstairs window and a great portion of the wall. By doing this, Elizabeth’s legs and lengthy skirt spilled out the front of the angel-shaped tower. The weight from Elizabeth’s protruding lower half caused her to slip out of the library entirely.

Elizabeth slid down the Columbian angel’s metallic gown, eventually reaching its base with less pain than she had expected. She quickly realized that this was because she was still growing. She kept growing until, eventually, she was tall enough that her head Monument Tower’s waistline.
Without much intermediate thought, Elizabeth continued to focus on Dewitt, the man who had so rudely broken into her home. She reached her arm above her head and pried her hand into the hole she had made in the tower as if she were checking a high shelf for a nearly unreachable item. Elizabeth blindly swept her open palm through the library, unknowingly causing great damage to its contents, until she swiped the struggling body of the now minuscule home invader.

Elizabeth held Dewitt up to her scowling face. Disoriented, Dewitt could only weakly look toward her face and see her massive, godlike eyes staring into him. “Well,” Elizabeth began, the volume of her voice almost too much for him to handle,” I guess the Vigor worked fine after all. SO, little man, what do you have to say for yourself?”

“I was just trying to help you,” Booker shouted, knowing the volume difference that would come with the new size difference,” honest. I was going to help you escape, from that tower and this city. You’ve gotta believe me, please!”

Elizabeth weighed the options in her mind. Did she believe him or not?
1331.title: Booker shows up

choices: Columbian authorities interrupt
Elizabeth decides what to do with Booker and gets away
13311.content:
Elizabeth looked at him for a second. It seemed very unlikely, but he very well could be telling the truth. It didn't really matter now. Just look at how big she is! This stranger posed no threat to her anymore. Elizabeth decided to give him a chance. "Ok! I'll believe you, but I'll crush you if I need to!" She warns. Booker is a bit relieved that she actually decided to believe him. It was a bit surprising too. Booker expected her to just crush him for breaking into her tower home.

"Thank you!" Booker shouts up to her. "I promise you won't need to crush me! I'm here to help!" Elizabeth couldn't help but giggle a bit. "You? Help me? That's funny. At this size I imagine it's you who would need help from me." She made a good point. Booker wasn't too happy with the position of helplessness he was forced into here. "So who are you, little man? Er, Dewitt, right?" The giantess asks. "Yeah. It's Booker Dewitt, and I don't need help from you." Booker responds. Elizabeth gets a smug look. "Oh? Let's see you get back onto the ground from here." Booker looks around. It looks a little too dangerous to get down on his own. "I'd rather not risk it." He says. Elizabeth laughs a bit, the sound of her voice booming. "I guess your sticking with me for a bit then."

"So what exactly did you come to help me with, Mr. Dewitt?" Elizabeth questions. "I came to break you out, but you did a fine job of that yourself." Dewitt answered. "So come on. Let's get out of this place." He adds, trying to keep his focus on the job. Elizabeth just smirks. "I don't think your in much of a position to tell me where to go, Mr. Dewitt. I think the first place I'll visit at this size is Paris. It can't be too hard like this, huh?"

That's when she looks around and realizes the citizens of Columbia staring up at her. "Wow, everyone is just so tiny to me. It's like they're all just a bunch of ants." Elizabeth says as she smiles and waves down to the growing crowd. They stare in awe, not sure if this giant posed a friend or foe. "Well Mr. Dewitt I appreciate your... efforts to free me. It was very kind of you, but I think I can take care of myself from here." "Wait!" Booker screams out. He could let her get away. Maybe he could convince her... "Can you at least take me with you? I know there is absolutely no reason to keep me along, but I would like it if you kept me around." Booker hopes she would listen until the chance came to have her come along. Elizabeth once again looks at Booker, thinking about what to do.
13311.title: Booker is given a chance

choices: Yes
No
133112.title: Does Booker come along?

choices: Off to Paris For Some Sightseein'
Elizabeth Gets Noticed by French People
1331121.content:
“Well,” Elizabeth said, looking at the miniscule man in her palm,” I suppose you are the first person I’ve talked to in, well… Huh, I can’t even remember. Well, it’s settled then, Mister Dewitt. You can come with me.”

“Yeah,” Booker replied,” glad we’re on the same page here. So, I know you mentioned Paris, but what if we went to-“”Oh, of course!” Elizabeth exclaimed in excitement. The sheer volume of her voice almost shattered Booker’s eardrums, along with causing the curious Columbian spectators to wince.

“Of course… What?” Booker asked, his hands resting on his ringing ears.

“Maybe at this size, I’ll have more power,” Elizabeth said, her voice dampening,” So, if I focused hard enough…” After stating this, she set Booker on top of a nearby building, telling him to wait a moment. Elizabeth breathed deeply, spread her arms out horizontally, and shut her eyes, her face holding a look of almost Zen-like concentration. The citizens of Columbia watched in anticipation from various floating platforms, not knowing what this giant girl was about to do.

“What the hell is she doing…?” Booker muttered to himself as he, too, watched Elizabeth’s strange performance.

After a few seconds of silence, an uneasy rumbling that emanated from Elizabeth hummed through the area, causing moderate vibrations on nearby structures. Suddenly, a massive vertical line of distortion appeared front of her monolithic frame, near the edge of the floating island. Elizabeth set her arms in front of herself and deepened her focus. She then grunted and slowly spread her arms back apart. She strained against some invisible force, as if she was attempting to rip a piece of solid steel in half with her bare hands.

Eventually, the hole in time and space opened, leaving the people of Columbia (and Booker) staring in astonishment. Elizabeth had opened an apartment building-sized tear into the lush French countryside, only a couple miles outside Paris. Elizabeth opened her eyes and saw that she had been successful, and was so excited that she couldn’t say a word.

“Uh, Miss,” Booker questioned, yelling as loudly as possible from his rooftop,” why is France in front of you?”

Without warning, Elizabeth snatched up Booker, giddy with excitement. “Come on, Mister Dewitt,” she said, barely restraining her urge to scream in happiness,” It’s a tear! It’s a way to Paris!”

“Paris…?” Booker asked, dazed from the motion of being grabbed so strongly,” But I have to get you back to New York…”

“New York?” Elizabeth said, looking at Booker in confusion,” Uh, sure, maybe later. But for now…” Elizabeth refocused her eyes on the tear. Without hesitation, she almost skipped through the tear and ended up on a grassy, brightly lit plain in midsummer France.

After stepping through the tear, Elizabeth had to take a moment to recompose herself in her new environment. Her natural adaptations to the low air pressure of Columbia took a moment to adjust to the more abundant air supply of the surface, which resulted in some stifled breathing and slight dizziness. Elizabeth held her hands to her chest as she transitioned to the feeling of being on solid ground, firmly pressing Booker against her left breast.

Squirming his way up from his pillowy entrapment, Booker heard and felt Elizabeth’s struggles with the greater air pressure of the surface. Since he didn’t have the time to fully adjust to Columbia’s atmosphere, Booker’s body readily accepted being back on solid ground (or at least close to it,) so he was confused as to what was wrong. Nevertheless, he was still confused. “Is everything alright, Elizabeth?” Booker asked.

As if on cue, Elizabeth’s breathing began to balance out and her sense of balance became regulated. “I feel fine now, Mister Dewitt,” she replied, looking down at the tiny man that she cradled almost like a small child," but thank you for your concern." However, it was then that the reality of the situation hit Elizabeth head-on.

“Oh my God,” she said,” I’m out! And I’m near Paris!”

“Yeah, that’s fantastic,” Booker said, slouching back into the softness of Elizabeth’s chest. This didn’t last long, as Elizabeth brought her hands back out in front of her face, holding Booker in the cup between them. “There’s so much to see and do,” she said,” but what should we do first? We could go and see the Lourve, or the Triomphe, or we could just go straight to the Tower, or- there’s just too much!”

“…New York might also be pretty neat,” Booker weakly suggested.

“But what should we do first? Hm…”
1331121.title: Off to Paris

choices: ...they're armed. And they don't look happy to see us."
...normal people. They look like they're watching me."
13311211.content:
“Well, I guess we can decide when we get there,” Elizabeth declared, holding her tiny companion out in front of herself,” Does that sound alright, Mister Dewitt?”

“Yeah. And call me Booker.”

“Oh, alright, Booker.” Elizabeth mockingly replied, turning her attention toward the city of Paris in the distance. Or what would have been “the distance” to a normal-sized person; at Elizabeth’s height, it looked like it would only take a leisurely stroll to reach the city. Judging by the position of the rising line of urban real estate, she guessed that she was south of the city. “Well,” Elizabeth said, holding Booker near her stomach,” off we go.”

Elizabeth stayed close the footpaths adjacent to the nearby farmlands, hoping to not attract too much attention. She inevitably did, however; within minutes of her arrival, hundreds of country-dwelling French men and women were alerted to her presence and rushing to alert their neighbors, friends, and family, barely able to believe what they were witnessing.

Most of the people who observed Elizabeth didn’t dare go anywhere near her as she stomped her way toward Paris. One of the few who did- a teenage farm boy who was entranced by the giant woman’s almost mythical size and beauty- stood beneath a tree situated near the footpath hoping to get a closer look at her as she passed by. As she did, however, the shockwaves sent out by her girth-filled footsteps threw the young farmhand off his feet and into Elizabeth’s path. Noticing this, Booker yelled at Elizabeth to stop- just as the underside of her boot was a mere inches from the boy.

“What’s wrong, Booker?”

“Just take a step back,” Booker said. Elizabeth complied, and as she looked down to see what had been nearly crushed beneath her foot, she spotted the teenager face-down on the ground, quivering in fear. “Oh my God,” she said, almost losing control of her volume,” I could’ve killed him…”

“You should probably be a bit more careful from now on,” Booker suggested.

“I agree,” Elizabeth said before turning her attention toward the still frightened boy on the ground, bending down to get a better look at him.

“Je suis desole,” she said, prodding lightly at his back with her free finger. The boy cautiously got up, dusted himself off, and looked upward toward Elizabeth. “M-merci, mademoiselle,” he weakly said before running off.

“Okay,” Elizabeth said, sighing in relief,” let’s continue.”

As Elizabeth and Booker traversed the warm, blue-skied French farmlands, conversation inevitably continued between the two. Booker was the first to speak after a minute of silent travel.

“I’m still a bit confused on how we’re… Here.” Booker said as he reclined in Elizabeth’s cupped hand.

“Oh, do you mean the tear that I opened?” Elizabeth asked as she kept her eyes trained on the ground for more pedestrians.

“Is that what you call that thing that led us here?”

“That’s what they’re referred to as in the books I’ve read. Tears are points in spacetime that connect two different universes to each other. It’s sort of like a window into another world. Or a door, in this case.”

“So, you can’t normally just go through them?”

“Actually, I used to pass through tears all the time when I was younger. But after I grew into a teenager, I lost the ability to travel freely between them.”

“Until today.”

“Well, sort of. I’ve never been entirely sure what gives me the ability to create tears, but since I began losing the ability to move through them, I’ve began to hypothesize that my power to create them come from a finite source. So, when I became larger from the effects of that Vigor, I assumed that the output of my power would scale up as well. Since I was apparently right, I managed to open a large tear that was freely traversable.”

“…Alright, you’ll have to get back to me on that later,” Booker said, scratching his head.
“Hey, speaking of your size,” Booker resumed,” just how tall are you, anyway?”

“Big enough to hold you like a miniature figurine,” Elizabeth said, smiling and running her free hand’s pointer finger over Booker’s torso,” but I think the Vigor bottle said something about two-hundred feet.”

“So, that’s how tall you are right now?”

“Maybe a little less than that,” Elizabeth said, stopping briefly to give herself a quick once-over before continuing her march,” If I were that big, you’d be like an insect to me.”

“Funnily enough, I already feel that way,” Booker chuckled.

After a few more minutes of traveling, Booker and Elizabeth arrived at the exterior suburbs of Paris. The rows of ornate apartment complexes and storefronts, most around five stories in height, ran for hundreds of meters before breaking off into side streets and alleyways. The buildings seemed to come just barely up to Elizabeth’s hips, giving Booker a wide view of the streets and rooftops. The streets themselves were notably vacant, save for a few wandering civilians. “Huh, looks like we’re already within the city limits,” Booker said.

“We are,” Elizabeth said, her smile growing,” I’m so excited to see everything! I still can hardly believe I’m out…”

“Wait a minute,” Booker said, gazing down the road to see a large mass of figures gathered a great distance from himself and his giant companion. The unimpeded rays of the sun prevented him from discerning exactly who they were. “…What the hell’s their problem?” Booker muttered as he positioned his right hand above his eyes as a visor, Elizabeth’s pace grinding to a halt.

“I can tell from here, Booker,” Elizabeth said,” they look like…
13311211.title: Off to Paris For Some Sightseein'

choices: She calls upon versions of herself from other realities
She brings you to the bathroom

15.title: Another scenario?

choices: She notices the citizens have shrunk
She doesn't notice them
Switch to a shrunken Booker's perspective, trying to get her attention
151.content:
Elizabeth was sitting in her tower, reading one of the many books stored in it along with her. Suddenly she heard the sound of Songbird. "What does he want?" Elizabeth thinks aloud, a bit irritated by the screeching. However, it seemed more quiet and distant for some reason. Realizing this, she looks above. Coming towards her was Songbird, but he was small! About the size of an actual bird. "What? W-what happened?" She asks, dumbfounded. She never got her answer, but she did start to smile. "I suppose this means you won't be keeping me locked up anywhere now huh?" She walks away, ignoring the tiny machine bird.

Elizabeth kept walking to the exit, unfazed by the shrunken bird's attempts to stop her. She picks the lock easily. After gaining access to the door, she turns to deal with her little nuisance. "Your really annoying me. You won't be coming with me I'm afraid." With that she slaps the robot down and pins it down with her boot. This breaks it slightly. "Now you stay there while I go finally see the outside!" Songbird laid there broken and Elizabeth had finally left her tower.

After the long descent down her prison, Elizabeth was quite disappointed to see things so empty. The city looked completely deserted as she approached. "I thought the outside world would be a little more... exciting." Elizabeth wondered as she walked.
151.title: The shrinking of Columbia

choices: Go to the theater
Walk past
1512.content: Elizabeth walks on, blissfully unaware of the tiny citizens of Colombia beneath her, literally. One shopkeeper, by the name of Mark Howard, runs out waving his arms trying to get Elizabeth's attention but Elizabeth doesn't notice and poor Mark Howard is reduced to nothing but a red stain on the bottom of Elizabeth's boot. Elizabeth continues to walk noticing a Theatre on her left, she had always wanted to go to the theatre, she had read many plays in her tower: Romeo and Juliet, Othello and Richard III. She thought to herself "Maybe that's why no ones outside, there might be a play on." But she also thought that she needed to find a man she read about called Comstock, maybe he could help her find out why she was trapped in her tower, he was a prophet after all.
1512.title: She doesn't notice them

choices: Climb her skirt to reach her face
Pop off a few rounds
1513.content:
“This job just keeps getting stranger,” Booker muttered to himself as he adjusted to his new situation. Just a moment ago, he had been on the run from the Columbian militia on his way to Monument Island, blasting his way through hordes of soldiers and leaping from skyline to skyline. Now he was the size of a chess piece, standing next to the massive leg of a Café chair near a sidewalk.

Judging by the lack of giant people, it seemed that Booker wasn’t alone in getting shrunken. How or why it happened didn’t matter; to him, it was just another obstacle. Booker looked down at his hip. “At least my guns shrunk with me,” he said, drawing his pistol from its holster. “That probably means they’ll still be armed, too. I just need to keep moving. Get the girl, that’s all that matters.” Booker raised his left hand in front of his face and inspected it. “Huh… I wonder if my Vigors still work.”

Booker’s pondering was stopped by the deep sounds of distant footsteps. “I guess not everyone was shrunken after all,” he mused. The booming steps seemed to be coming from the sidewalk, so Booker took cover behind the metal chair leg on the side facing the Café. He peered out to see the face of the giant that he was hiding from, and it was none other than the face that was on the picture given to him by the people who had sent him on this crazy mission in the first place.

Elizabeth stomped by, scanning the street and its rows of buildings for any signs of life. “Hello? Is anyone there?” No response came. “This is so strange… Where is everyone? Huh… Maybe that’s why no one ever comes to see me. There’s no one here in the first place!” Elizabeth giggled a bit on her last comment, but then sighed. “Still… I was kind of hoping to meet some people.”

As the blue-skirted giantess crossed Booker’s field of vision, he realized that he needed to seize this opportunity. “She’d probably be better at piloting an airship than me at this point, anyway,” Booker said as he slid over the foot of the chair leg and ran after Elizabeth, who was still casually strolling along. While chasing after her, he jumped and shouted, “Hey! Miss! Do you see me down here?” Elizabeth didn’t even glance back at him. “Damn it, she can’t hear me,” Booker said, still running along,” I need to get her attention, but how?”
1513.title: Bring Us the Giantess, Wipe Away the Debt

choices: Booker Continued Uninterrupted
Elizabeth Takes a Seat in a Nearby Park
15131.content:
Continuing to chase after the gargantuan Elizabeth, Booker decided against firing his pistol to get her attention. “With all this wind, she probably wouldn’t hear gunfire from where I’m standing. I could probably climb her dress by grabbing hold of the threads.” Despite years of alcoholism, Booker’s military training gave him a nearly unquenchable supply of stamina. As Elizabeth’s left foot hit the ground and her right foot careened forward, the lower rim of her dress caught against the end of her boot. Taking advantage of this, Booker leapt forth and grabbed onto of the rim with both his hands.

Booker grasped the blue threads firmly as Elizabeth’s left foot swung forward. The dress drooped back into hanging loosely over the ground, so the tiny man began clawing his way up the wall of fabric. Booker’s climb was somewhat sluggish, as Elizabeth’s skirt swayed and crinkled with every step the girl took. Higher and higher he ascended, wedging his hands and feet between the threads before lifting himself up another level. Eventually, he noticed that the curtain-like dress became less wavy and more consistent, with a smooth, curved bulge pushing out from behind the fabric. He then realized that this must be Elizabeth’s bouncy, rounded rear.

Though being on Elizabeth’s butt allowed Booker to climb faster, it also presented a few problems. She might feel his tiny hands poking against her soft skin, which would lead to him getting discovered by an angry, accusatory young woman. Or maybe something even worse could happen. Still, Booker had to keep going, or else he might loose his grip and never have a chance of making contact with the girl at all. But how did it go?
15131.title: On Elizabeth's Backside

choices: Booker's squirming causes her to find him
He passes out under the immense pressure
151312.content:
Booker ascends slowly. He would very much like to climb past this young woman's derriere as fast as possible, but considering if she felt him there it might not end very well for him. So he tries to keep his touching of her mountainous rear light, slowing him down. Unfortunately, his caution will prove to be rather detrimental to his progress...

Elizabeth continued to stroll through the micro populated city of Columbia, her wandering bringing her into a park. "Oh a park! A close look at nature, without a tear!" She runs over to the park merrily, excited to nature from outside the tower. Booker's climb was made even more difficult with the rapid movement. He was able to cling tight enough, but he had to keep going like this as Elizabeth would just not stop moving. "Oh look at these flowers! and that butterfly looks so beautiful!" She moves around constantly, bending over and crouching to observe the outside world and it's inhabitants. Although all the human inhabitants were either hiding, or ended up meeting a terrible fate under her boots...

"All of this is so exciting! I think I'll take a moment to relax and really take it all in. Now where's a good spot..." Booker was not concerned much about what she was saying, trying to collect himself again and focus on climbing again now that she has calmed down a bit. A nearby bench caught Elizabeth's eye. "Perfect!" She starts walking towards it, meanwhile Booker was climbing what seemed to be the largest rear in the world. "Almost past it... then I'll be one step closer!" He mutters to himself. Unfortunately he was going a thousand steps back as the world crashes down on him.

Elizabeth had taken a seat on the bench, pinning Booker under her massive ass. Booker had fortunately ended up between her two ginormous cheeks, allowing him at least enough room to live. As if it wasn't happening fast enough for Booker, she began shifting around trying to get comfortable. The large mounds of flesh ground against him. Booker could do nothing but squirm against the power of this huge ass.
151312.title: Elizabeth Goes to the Park

choices: She thought he was honest
She thought he was perverted
1513121.content:
After adjusting her position and making herself comfortable, Elizabeth relaxed and sank into her seat. Accompanied only by the sun, the wind, and the atmosphere of nature, the girl marveled at all the new sensations she was experiencing. She closed her eyes and breathed deeply, taking in the aromas of the trees and flowers as she processed the world around her. “This is so wonderful,” she softly spoke, “there’s just so much to see and do out here… But I think I’ll stay here just a little longer.”

Unbeknownst to her, a shrunken man known as Booker Dewitt was currently fighting to remain conscious underneath her shapely rear. Being between the cheeks of Elizabeth’s buttocks had resulted in him getting smacked around and smothered as the girl shifted around to reach a more comfortable sitting position. Now she had found that position, however. For Elizabeth, this was just a passing moment of relief. For Booker, it was extremely dangerous as the girl’s gigantic pelvic area now descended toward him, the soft flesh of her ass filling the seat and slowly becoming still.

Booker did what anyone would do in his situation; he panicked, squirming and kicking against the cloth-covered mound of flesh that threatened to envelop and suffocate him. Unfortunately, Elizabeth was so relaxed that she didn’t pay the strange feeling beneath her rear any mind. The shrunken former soldier intensified his struggles, punching and grasping uselessly at the amorphous mass that seemed to have engulfed him completely. This definitely was not how Booker Dewitt intended to die, so he resolved to fight until he was drained of energy, hoping for a stroke of luck.

The luck that Booker desired appeared when he left a particularly sharp kick against the giant girl’s pelvic bone. Elizabeth finally began to notice the tiny man’s struggles, wincing a little as she felt something poke against her bottom. Sighing, she muttered to herself, “What is that? It feels… Odd.” The young lady stood up from her seat and turned around to examine the bench. Very quickly, she saw something unusual on the flattened wood- the tiny form of what looked like a human body.

Booker weakly sat up in relief as the pressure of Elizabeth’s butt suddenly vanished. As his eyes readjusted to sunlight, however, he saw that the giant girl now loomed over the bench, peering down at him. Booker realized that now was a good a time as any, so he waved his arms and called out Elizabeth’s name.

“Is that a… Person?” Elizabeth asked, her mouth curled in confusion. She bent over for a closer look at the petite being, and saw that it was not only moving, but definitely resembled a human. Elizabeth then got down on her knees to observe the being even closer, allowing her to hear out what sounded like speech. The sudden approach of her face also seemed to startle him; the tiny man backed away from her imminent visage, shouting, “Hey, hey! That’s close enough!”

“What are you?” Elizabeth immediately questioned, her warm breath blowing Booker’s hair back.

“I’m the man who’s gonna help you to leave this crazy city. Now, if you give your-“”No,” Elizabeth interrupted, “I mean, are you human?’

“…The hell kind of question is that? I’m as human as anyone else who’s been shrunken, if that’s what you’re concerned about.”

“Wait,” Elizabeth said, her confused expression turning into a frown,” were you the thing that was… Under me?”

“What? Well, yeah, I guess I was.” Without warning, Elizabeth’s hand swooped under Booker and snatched him up. Elizabeth stood back to her full height and held the little man in an open palm in front of her scowling face. “Hey, hey, what the hell’s going on?”

“Were you trying to take advantage of my inattentiveness, little man?”

“Huh? No, I was just trying to reach you by climbing your dress. That was it, I didn’t mean anything by it!“

Elizabeth paused for a moment. How did she react to this?
1513121.title: Elizabeth Finds Booker

info.brief_description: My size changing interactive for Elizabeth from bioshock infinite. (Possible spoilers)
info.description:
WARNING: You might get spoiled if you haven't played the game yet. Read at your own risk.

A new size interactive of Elizabeth from Bioshock: Infinite growing into a giantess or interacting with shrunken people because I noticed she wasn't getting any love around here.

What I like and what the story should be centered around:
Butt
Feet
Breasts
Sweat
Farting

Please add an actual chapter when you contribute. At least a paragraph or something please. Also use good grammar and spelling.

Stay away from ending the story.

Enjoy!
